meanings.definition: To prepare or make by combining ingredients
meanings.sent1: I will concoct a delicious soup for dinner tonight.
meanings.sent2: She likes to concoct new recipes in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to concoct a cake using unusual ingredients.
meanings.sent4: He managed to concoct a magical potion in his laboratory.
meanings.sent5: The students were asked to concoct their own salad dressing for the cooking class.

meanings.definition: To devise or invent (a story, plan, etc.)
meanings.sent1: The author will concoct an exciting adventure for her next book.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to concoct elaborate excuses for being late.
meanings.sent3: The detective had to concoct a clever alibi to solve the case.
meanings.sent4: She managed to concoct a brilliant plan to surprise her friends.
meanings.sent5: The children decided to concoct a story about a magical land during playtime.

meanings.definition: To concoct a scheme or plan
meanings.sent1: The group will concoct a strategy for the upcoming project.
meanings.sent2: They needed to concoct a plan to escape from the locked room.
meanings.sent3: The friends decided to concoct a prank on April Fools' Day.
meanings.sent4: She tried to concoct a scheme to get out of doing her chores.
meanings.sent5: The team had to concoct a clever scheme to win the competition.
